message: i haven't used it for anything that manages the audio itself, but the primary goal of my biwako project is to support loading/saving of a variety of music formats
so i'd be interested to see what tools are available to tackle the actual audio
Anyone use python for making music or playing with dsp? Lot's of fun ideas and projects to discuss: pyfluidsynth, pyo, sndobj, pyportmidi, txosc, ..., chuck, supercollider, puredata, etc.
Count me in. I'd be interested (though not familiar enough with the options).

@Gulopine yep, the theme would be relatively flexible - it can be non-realtime processing of audio, live coding type things, whatever. I'd love to hear about biwako and other projects related to music/audio people are working on.
@daniellindsley yep, if you're interested in just learning about music/audio with python or just want to ask questions, that would be awesome.
I'd love to learn about the fun and exciting world of python in audio ;/p
bump
i'm also really interested in learning more about pure data which i've only fiddled with briefly. seems like a powerful way to describe audio processing pipelines.
I'd join in. Right now I'm hacking on Yet Another pure data <-> python bridge (like pyata or purity).
haven't set a time yet. any preferences? o.w. i'll post something later today - likely will choose some time tomorrow.
I'm down.
sounds interesting
I just noticed that the Open Spaces wiki has a Python In Music BoF already listed, scheduled for 7 PM on Saturday. Is that the same as this? If not, it should be :-)
Oh, If the person who posted is listening - can we hijack this?
Hell yes!  I posted the python in music thing on the open spaces board and the wiki (http://us.pycon.org/2011/openspaces/music/).  Is Saturday at 7pm good for everyone?
This could be cool. Anyone else ever messed with Echo Nest? Would love to hear about DSP, etc.
Where is Hanover F?
i loves me some echonest, @atl gave a great talk about it last year
cool, so sat 7:00 pm will be the official Python for Music + Audio/DSP BoF! ... looking forward to this
Can't wait :)
Hanover F is down one flight from the main conference rooms.
@JoshMock: I've used the Echo Nest API a fair amount and would be happy to talk about it
I hope it's "Balls of Fury"
@adrianh That would be awesome! I gave a demo of the Remix API to high schoolers last week in Nashville, but I'm still fairly new to it.
JoshMock -- Birds Of a Feather
It's when people with similar interests meet to talk about their interest
Also: someone please tell this Pycon newb what "BoF" stands for
Nice, this is exciting; somebody pressure @djfroofy to opensource the beat+lounge
not nearly as cool, but I'll take it
@jonathanmarmor Yes, please! :)
I can talk for a few minutes about music21 (a python semantic music info analysis library) and Canoris, a web API (with python wrapper) for audio feature extraction.
Reminder: Please come to the Python in Music/Audio/DSP BoF Open Space at 7pm in Hanover F.
@jonathanmarmor echonest is great!
